Wer Portal gemocht hat, wird Portal 2 lieben: Längere Story, ausgefallenere Rätsel und glaubwürdige Charaktere machen dieses Spiel zu einem einmaligen Erlebnis. Absolute Kaufempfehlung!

Soberbio, muchísimo más completo que el original. Creativo, sorprendente y con un editor y mucho contenido adicional. Y el multijugador es único.
Superb, far more complete than the original Portal 1. Creative, surprising, editor included, full of additional content. And one more thing, unique multiplayer.
Where's my cake?

É dificil descrever o quão diferenciado este jogo é de qualquer outro que exista na indústria. Portal conseguiu criar, com uma ideia simplória e muito divertida, um jogo diferente dos demais, um real jogo de puzzle, um real jogo que desafia a sua mente a cada nova fase que você entra. E em Portal 2 isso é levado ainda mais longe com a introdução do modo cooperativo, sem sombra de dúvidas a melhor experiência cooperativa que eu já tive a oportunidade de experienciar em um video game.

Com puzzles e diálogos ainda melhores do que os do primeiro jogo, a campanha singeplayer do game continua sendo um prato cheio para todos que amam desafios e procuram dar mais algumas risadas com a Gladdos, mas, como eu disse, o grande destaque vai para a sua campanha e componentes cooperativos. Resolver todos esses enigmas e fases com um amigo e ver o quanto é possível criar fases onde realmente o trabalho em equipe é necessário fazem desse um jogo essencialmente obrigatório a qualquer um que aprecia um bom co-op.

Como se o conteúdo original do jogo já não bastasse, o mesmo ainda traz uma ferramenta de criação de mapas, o que simplesmente torna a vida útil do game infinita. Existem milhares de mapas (tanto Singleplayer quanto Multiplayer) no Workshop e basta baixá-los para já começar a jogar, sem complicações de instalação ou qualquer coisa do tipo.

Eu não tenho dúvidas que a Valve criou um dos melhores e mais criativos jogos de video game da história, e qualquer um que gosta de ter sua mente desafiada deveria um dia experimentar essa obra prima!

A brilliant evil genius, along with subordinate Stephen Merchant, have the protagonist on a wild goose chase for freedom in the hit sequel, An Idiot Abroad 2. I mean Portal 2.

This is the greatest puzzle game ever.  There is no other game even remotely like it.  Except Portal 1.  Of course.  But that goes without saying, right?

Why are you still reading this?  GO PLAY IT.  (And then play it again on Co-op, because that's a whole nother game.)
Excellent humor, great story telling. The game has 2 or 3 points spaced several hours apart where it's easy to set down.
Wicked Game

Though it's hard to fill the shoes of the original, Portal 2 does a pretty great job. Tons of new story and content to play through, though GLaDOS is a bit different from what you may remember. The Co-Op mode in particular however brings back much of her original bile, as well as introduces the opportunity to play with a friend. It's been hours of fun every time so far. My only regret is that there's only so many maps to play through. Even though the game is gigantic, I still want to solve more puzzles, explore new environments and dunk loved ones in acid. Fret not, for there is an online community and although good maps with no glitches can be hard to find, they are out there. Also, if you feel up to it, as always with Source games, you get the SDK, so you can create your own environments. So get crackin' peeps. Get portalin'! For science!

P.S.: The soundtrack is fantastic!
Beyni sulandırıyor, mide bulandırıyor, kafa karıştırıyor... Sabaha karşı huzurlu bir uykunun içine s*çmak için birebir!

Everything I could ever hope from the sequel of one of my favorite games of all time. I was a little afraid Wheatley wouldn't tie in to the Aperture mythology, but the story here does more: it makes him, and all other surprise additions, almost as essential as the Companion Cube and the mysterious "Rat Man". And I'm just talking about the single-player campaign! [i]Portal 2[/i] is a must-have!

I didn't think it's possible to make a satisfying sequel of the first "Portal" - and how wrong I was! It pushes the boundaries of what a quality storytelling can do without tons of cutscenes pulling you away from the game, and combines it with some of the most satisfying gameplay in years. It's familiar grounds without feeling simply like more of the same, and my personal game of the year 2011.
GotY, for sure. If you haven't played Portal 2 yet, go get it now!

I highly recommend Portal 2 to all gamers, especially those who play violent action-shooters (*cough* like me *cough*) because it's different and you really need a break from al that blood and headshots, etc. This game involves more thinking, while it keeps the intensity of a FPS. Also, it doubles the fun if you play with a friend some coop chambers, or you can make new friends by trying to play with a random player.
The cake is not a lie here, enjoy!
